modName: Sexy Well-Stocked Vendors and FENCES -- Does not alter vanil
summary: Adds well stocked crafting vendors to Skyrim.  No more scrounging around for materials.
descriptionHtml:
Sexy Crafting Vendors v2.0.0

Please endorse/rate if you like it.  


===========================================================
-----------------------  IMPORTANT  -----------------------
===========================================================

There is a bug in Skyrim (not in my mod) that will cause a merchant to STOP PAYING GOLD when a player sells items to them.  They will continue to take your items, but you will get no gold in return.  This happens when the vendor accumulates over 30k in gold.  So, the solution is 2fold. . . 

1)  My vendors will now have 20k gold per reset.  
2)  Make sure to do all of your selling before you buy from them and push them over the 30k threshhold.  

I have tested this with vanilla vendors and my vendors and have found it to be true in all of my tests.  


A thank you to SkyDruid on nexus forums.  See his post here:  http://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/topic/582784-bug-report-30000-merchant-gold/



===========================================================
Recommended
===========================================================

I had to do a fresh save to get the fence to work properly for me.  

Step-by-step:  
1)  Uninstall Sexy Crafting Merchants mod.  
2)  Enter Skyrim.  
3)  Enter a cell (I used belethors).  
4)  Press ~ to open console, type \"pcb\" (without quotes) then press enter.  Press ~ again to close console.  
5)  Make a new save.  
6)  Exit game.  
7)  Install Sexy Crafting Merchants 1.5.5.  
8)  Load the new save.  Done.  



===========================================================
Description
===========================================================

The goal of this mod is to add better stocked vendors throughout all of Skyrim.  This is a work in progress.  These vendors will each be well-stocked in their own type of merchandise, but will buy anything that\'s not stolen, and have lots of gold to spend.  



So far you can find them in:  

Falkreath
Ivarstead
Markarth
Riften
Rorikstead
Riverwood
Solitude
Whiterun
Windhelm and 
Winterhold

36 and counting in total.  



===========================================================
Blacksmith
===========================================================

Sells:  

-Plenty of leveled enchanted armor, arrows and weapons
-25 Each Ore
-25 Each Ingot
-05 Each Gem
-25 Charcoal
-25 Rolls of Paper
-25 Leather
-50 Leather Strips
-Wide selection of pelts and hides
-50 Lockpicks
-A Few Tools

And more.  


===========================================================
Alchemist 
===========================================================

Sells Ingrediants to make:  

-Damage Health
-Fortify Alteration
-Fortify Conjuration
-Fortify Destruction
-Fortify Illusion
-Fortify Restoration
-Fortify Enchanting
-Fortify Smithing
-Restore Health
-Restore Magicka
-Restore Stamina

And more.    


===========================================================
Mage
===========================================================

Sells: 

-All Spell Tomes
-More Soul Gems
-Tons of leveled:  
  -Scrolls
  -Rings
  -Necklaces
  -Staffs
  -Robes

And more.  


===========================================================
Fence
===========================================================

Sells: 

-Lockpicks
-Modest selection of poisons

Buys:

-Stolen goods (Fixed!  Finally!)



===========================================================
Installation
===========================================================

Preferred method is to download and install with Nexus Mod Manager.  Overwrite all.  

Or, of course, you can install manually by extracting the archive contents into your /data folder.  Overwrite all.  And making sure \"Sexy Crafting Merchants.esp\" is check in Skyrim Launcher.  



===========================================================
Changelog
===========================================================

v2.0.0 - Major release.  
         Added merchants to Falkreath, Markarth, Riften, Rorikstead, Solitude, Windhelm and Winterhold.  

v1.6.5 - Added merchants to Ivarstead.  

v1.6.0 - Added merchants to Riverwood.  
       - Tweaked alchemist\'s inventory.  

v1.5.5 - Got fence working!!!
       - Added a modest selection of poisons to fence.  
       - Added mammoth tusks to apothacary, per request.  
       - Lowered vendor gold stash to 20k, precautionary.  

v1.4.0 - Implemented a workaround for the bug that caused vendor to not pay gold when taking items.  
       - Shrank and moved chests out of the way.  

v1.3.1 - Think I fixed the FaceTint bug for reals this time.  

v1.3.0 - Added FaceGenData for NPCs to try to prevent FaceTint bug.  

v1.2.0 - Changed/diversifed their clothes.  
       - Gave them names.  
       - Added a fence to Belethor\'s.  (currently not working right)

v1.1.0 - Added Mage merchant.  (Didn\'t get uploaded, merged withg v1.2)  

v1.0.0 - Initial Release.  



===========================================================
To Do
===========================================================

-Incorporate a Hunter/Fletcher vendor type
-Tweak inventory as needed
-Spread them all over Skyrim



===========================================================
Conflicts
===========================================================

This mod should not conflict with anything.  
IF, for some odd reason, it does, leave comments.  



===========================================================
Check out all my mods  
===========================================================
